H0.text: Medications can slow down the increase of viruses in the blood.

H1.text: Platelets can slow down the increase of viruses in the blood.

H2.text: Infections can slow down the increase of viruses in the blood.

H3.text: Androgens can slow down the increase of viruses in the blood.

A4.text: Two drugs named zanamivir (Relenza) and oseltamivir (Tamiflu) that have been recently introduced to treat influenza prevent the release of viral particles by blocking a molecule named neuraminidase that is found on the surface of flu viruses, and also seems to be constant across a wide range of flu strains.

A5.text: One of the best-known of this class of drugs are interferons, which inhibit viral synthesis in infected cells.
